label: subject
definition: A person who participates in a clinical study.

label: local subject identifier
definition: Subject identifier, which must be unique within the study. Often the ID of the subject as recorded on a CRF.

label: unique subject identifier
definition: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product. This must be a unique number, and could be a compound identifier formed by concatenating STUDYID-SITEID-SUBJID.

label: study site identifier
definition: Unique identifier for a site within a study.

label: age
definition: Age expressed in AGEU. May be derived from RFSTDTC and BRTHDTC,  but BRTHDTC may not be available in all cases (due to subject privacy concerns).

label: sex
definition: Sex of the subject. Need to fill in with description from IG.

label: race
definition: Race of the subject. Sponsors should refer to "Collection of Race and Ethnicity Data in Clinical Trials" (FDA, October, 2016) for guidance regarding the collection of race (https://www.fda.gov/downloads/regulatoryinformation/guidances/ucm126396.pdf). See Assumption below regarding RACE.

label: race
definition: The ethnicity of the subject. Sponsors should refer to "Collection of Race and Ethnicity Data in Clinical Trials" (FDA, October, 2016) for guidance regarding the collection of ethnicity (https://www.fda.gov/downloads/regulatoryinformation/guidances/ucm126396.pdf).

label: arm code
definition: ARMCD is limited to 20 characters. It is not subject to the character restrictions that apply to TESTCD.The maximum length of ARMCD is longer than for other "short" variables to accommodate the kind of values that are likely to be needed for crossover trials. For example, if ARMCD values for a seven-period crossover were constructed using two-character abbreviations for each treatment and separating hyphens, the length of ARMCD values would be 20. If the subject was not assigned to an Arm, ARMCD is null and ARMNRS is populated.With the exception of studies which use multi-stage Arm assignments, must be a value of ARMCD in the Trial Arms Dataset.

label: description of planned arm
definition: Name of the Arm to which the subject was assigned. If the subject was not assigned to an Arm, ARM is null and ARMNRS is populated.With the exception of studies which use multi-stage Arm assignments, must be a value of ARM in the Trial Arms Dataset.

label: country of study site
definition: Country of the investigational site in which the subject participated in the trial.

label: death flag
definition: Indicates the subject died. Should be "Y" or null. Should be populated even when the death date is unknown.
